image.altText: Eva Lawler stands behind a podium talking on stage. She has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: In a speech Monday morning, Chief Minister Eva Lawler says her government will focus on getting more Territorians into jobs and call on the federal government to reform the Community Development Program — the remote work-for-the-dole program.

title.children: Chief minister outlines vision for NT, with Aboriginal employment and youth justice key focuses

image.altText: A flooded road

props.synopsis: There is a moderate chance a cyclone could form later this week as a monsoon trough looks likely to bring rain and flooding to already-saturated catchments after ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily.

title.children: Flood-ravaged, isolated residents brace for potential new cyclone in Gulf of Carpentaria

image.altText: Josh Frydenberg and Scott Morrison stand at podia with an Australian flag behind them

props.synopsis: Josh Frydenberg tells the ABC political docuseries Nemesis that Scott Morrison having himself sworn into the Treasury portfolio did lasting damage to their relationship. For his part, the former PM says he apologised to his former treasurer and the pair remain friends.

title.children: Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg were friends, colleagues and housemates. But there was something the PM had not told his treasurer

image.altText: Linda Reynolds stands at a lectern with a microphone against a blue background.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal cabinet minister Linda Reynolds has announced she will stand down from politics at the next federal election.

title.children: Liberal senator Linda Reynolds to quit politics at next election

image.altText: A montage of pictures of an American football game

props.synopsis: Super Bowl LVIII had just about everything — a sideline stoush between Travis Kelce and Andy Reid, a trick-play touchdown and a crucial blocked extra point. Here are the five quick hits from Las Vegas.

title.children: Super Bowl five quick hits: Kelce shoves his coach and a 49er suffers a shocking sideline injury in overtime thriller

image.altText: The left image shows a screenshot of McLaughin sitting on the boy (blurred), the right image is a profile photo of McLaughlin

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory mayor criticised for sitting on an Aboriginal child in Tennant Creek last year during what he described as a "citizen's arrest" says he has moved interstate after threats were made against his family.

title.children: Mayor moves family interstate over safety fears after 'citizen's arrest' video

image.altText: worker smooths concrete at a slab pour with other workers in background.

props.synopsis: Workers shoulder the burden of paying for the things we want: schools, hospitals and a civil, safe society. But as our population ages and more people need support, can income tax continue to fund our needs?

title.children: 'It's not just unfair but immoral': Why experts say Australia's tax system is broken and what can be done to fix it

image.altText: Grainy footage shows a man in a suit lying on the ground, one hand to his ear holding a phone.

props.synopsis: Barnaby Joyce says he "made a big mistake", blaming medication for his behaviour, after being filmed swearing into his phone while lying on his back on a Canberra street late last Wednesday.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce says late-night lie down 'a big mistake'

image.altText: A split image of a woman in a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: Missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy has three children with strong connections in the community and her disappearance has left some children feeling anxious.

title.children: School children left 'nervous' by disappearance of Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A grey-haired man in a light blue Snoopy tshirt that reads Be Happy

props.synopsis: Some of the more unsavoury practices of the country's multi-billion-dollar general insurance sector were on full display last week, including delays, denials, predatory low-ball cash settlement offers and gaslighting, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: The clock is ticking on an industry that plays hardball with customers at their weakest moments

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: Nearly 40 people released from immigration detention following a High Court decision last year have been told they do not have to wear an electronic monitoring bracelet despite the government talking tough on protecting the community.

title.children: Half of 149 released immigration detainees convicted of violent offending, kidnapping or robbery

image.altText: Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll

props.synopsis: Police Commissioner Karina Carroll asks for more powers for police to search people for weapons, particularly at shopping centres, after a grandmother's fatal stabbing.

title.children: Queensland police ask for more search powers, government to bring forward ban on selling knives to minors

image.altText: A young boy looking at a sheet of paper with words on it

props.synopsis: One-third of Australian students are failing to learn to read proficiently, at an estimated cost to the economy of $40 billion, according to a new study.

title.children: Popular teaching style 'contrary to science' costing Australia $40 billion, report finds

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: A NSW police operation has led to the arrest of 590 high risk domestic violence offenders, and involved officers from every area command and district in the state.

title.children: Close to 600 domestic violence offenders arrested in 'successful' NSW police operation

image.altText: Taylor and Travis

props.synopsis: The Kansas City Chiefs go back-to-back after scoring a touchdown in the dying seconds of overtime to break 49ers hearts. Look back on all the action.

title.children: Chiefs claim stunning Super Bowl win over 49ers in overtime to go back-to-back

image.altText: Usher pointing wearing white and a white diamond encrusted glove, side profile

props.synopsis: The term 'Taylor Swift's boyfriend' is trending on X as the pop star attends the Super Bowl flanked by rapper Ice Spice and actor Blake Lively. Usher's guests include Alicia Keys, Lil Jon, Ludacris and H.ER. while Beyoncé ad sets tongues wagging.

title.children: Usher's half-time show, Taylor Swift's boyfriend and Beyoncé has people talking at the Super Bowl

image.altText: Secretary of the Department of Defence Dennis Richardson speaks at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A review has found the former Coalition government awarded contracts for offshore asylum seeker processing to companies with suspected links to arms and drug smuggling, corruption and bribery.

title.children: Home Affairs contracts awarded to companies with suspected links to drugs, firearms and bribery

image.altText: An aerial view of the red dirt and trees of the Juukan Gorge.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's newly amended cultural heritage laws are being put to the test for the first time, six months after the state government was forced to backflip on its decision to introduce controversial sweeping legislative changes.

title.children: Local shire and contractor charged under first test case of amended Juukan Gorge laws

image.altText: The hand of an elderly woman reaches to answer a landline phone.

props.synopsis: Telehealth conferences related to voluntary assisted dying are currently illegal because of separate laws that make it a crime to encourage suicide over a carriage service. Independent MP Kate Chaney is pushing parliament to resolve that technical ban.

title.children: MP pushes to legalise telehealth consultations on voluntary assisted dying

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands and speaks in parliament, with government members sitting behind him

props.synopsis: National security, negative gearing and wider tax reforms dominate Monday's Question Time. Follow live.

title.children: Negative gearing and immigration detention in focus during Question Time

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Government increases visas for people declaring Palestinian and Israeli citizenship
Ex-Liberal minister Linda Reynolds to retire from politics
Wong warns of potentially 'devastating consequences' of Israeli raid in Rafah

image.altText: Children line up against a barrier with empty bowls

props.synopsis: The horrors of Gaza are almost unspeakable. As difficult as all this is to read and to watch, it's important the world does not look away, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The horrors facing Gaza's surviving children are unspeakable. How can this go on?

image.altText: A single firefighter fights a huge fire as it destroys wooden and plastic shelters

props.synopsis: In the Rohingya refugee camps of Cox's Bazar, more than 1 million people are living in worsening conditions. However, the world wasn't watching when tragedy unfolded.

title.children: A massive fire left 7,000 people, including thousands of children, homeless. Australia didn't seem to notice

image.altText: a pregnant woman holding her belly with a red upwards-facing arrow superimposed over the image

props.synopsis: Last year, four babies were recorded to have died in Queensland after contracting syphilis in the womb.

title.children: Cases of infectious syphilis in Queensland explode by 600 per cent in 15 years

image.altText: A man with short hair and an arm tattoo smiles at a camera

props.synopsis: Victorian water skier Luke Wentworth died from injuries suffered after he fell during the Southern 80 ski race on Sunday. Some are now calling for the race to be cancelled.

title.children: Death of a seventh competitor prompts debate over safety of Southern 80 Murray River race

image.altText: A police vehicle parked on grass with a broken motel sign visible behind

props.synopsis: Police allege a 39-year-old man shot dead this morning in the rural township of Ilbilbie, south of Mackay, pulled a firearm on officers before being fatally shot.

title.children: Man shot dead by police in Central Queensland

image.altText: Kelvin Kiptum looks on

props.synopsis: Kenyan world marathon record holder Kelvin Kiptum has died in an accident aged 24.

title.children: World Marathon record holder, Kenya's Kelvin Kiptum, dead aged 24

image.altText: John Wilson stands looking concerned and rugged up on a NYC street, camera in hand.

props.synopsis: Documentarian John Wilson talks about his unique approach to television, where he shifts our sense of the ridiculous from individuals to their environment.

title.children: This bizarre TV show you've probably never heard of might just change how you view the world

image.altText: A group of people stand in a V formation with holding slogans for justice.

props.synopsis: Based on the ongoing British Post Office scandal, the four-part series has seen the downfall of multiple high-profile people responsible for the controversy.

title.children: Why a show about the post office broke viewing records when it aired in the UK
